item.name: Encumbered
item.text: The weight of your equipment is more than 5 times your strength score
Source: Custom rule to handle speed reduction

item.name: Heavily Encumbered
item.text: The weight of your equipment is more than 15 times your strength score
Source: Custom rule to handle speed reduction

item.name: Tooth of the White Dragon
item.text: Rarity: Legendary
Requires attunement

This legendary weapon is one of 10 blades that make up the Mouth of the Dragon. The blade was forged in the icy breath of a long forgotten white dragon and as such the blade has a white, frosted look to it. A giant milk quartz makes up the cross guard, the quartz is cut to resemble the outstretched limbs of a dragon, each claw clutching a blood red ruby. The pommel is a circular disk with each side having the nine blades carved in it. The hilt is wrapped in supple yeti hide.

You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. On a successful melee hit with the blade, the target takes an extra 3d6 cold damage. In addition, while you hold the sword, you have vulnerability to fire damage.
In freezing temperatures, the blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
When you draw this weapon, you can extinguish all nonmagical flames within 30 feet of you. This property can be used once per short rest.
Versatile: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property — the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.
Proficiency: martial, longsword
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Tooth of the Black Dragon
item.text: Rarity: Legendary
Requires attunement

This legendary weapon is one of 10 blades that make up the Mouth of the Dragon. This rapier has a darkened blade, hardened in an ancient black dragon's pool of acid. When drawn, the blade glistens with acid. The basket hilt is crafted of a copper mesh made to resemble the drowning vines that inhabit many bogs. The grip is made of 7 glass beads that shows how much acid is left in the blade before it runs dry for the day.

When the command word "vellious" is spoken as a bonus action, one of the doses of acid stored in the grip is transferred to the blade. On the next successful attack made with the blade, the weapon adds 1d6 acid damage. The grip houses seven such doses, all used doses are replenished at dawn.
When traveling through swamps, the bearer of this blade knows which way is north and cannot become lost.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. In addition, while you hold the sword, you have resistance to acid damage.
Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Proficiency: martial, rapier
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Tooth of the Blue Dragon
item.text: Rarity: Legendary
Requires attunement

This legendary weapon is one of 10 blades that make up the Mouth of the Dragon. This dagger crackles with lightning when drawn. The blade is silvered and etched in ancient runes that names this blade as The Tooth of the Dragon. The hilt and cross guard are shapped to resemble a blue dragon with outstretched wings.

You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. On a successful melee hit the blade, the target takes an extra 1d4 lightning damage, as lightning arcs from the wings of the dragon into the target. In addition, while you hold the dagger, you have resistance to lightning damage.
When traveling through desert terrain the bearer of this blade cannot be surprised by any non-magical means.
Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Light: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

Range: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.

Thrown: If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the finesse property.
Proficiency: simple
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Tooth of the Green Dragon
item.text: Rarity: Legendary
Requires attunement

This legendary weapon is one of 10 blades that make up the Mouth of the Dragon. This shortsword drips with poison when drawn. The blade has a green tint to it and ancient runes runds down it's length naming the blade as The Tooth of the Dragon. The hilt and cross guard are nondescript.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. On a successful melee hit the blade, the target takes an extra 1d6 poison damage.
The sword holds three charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge as an action to cast Melf's Acid Arrow from it. The sword regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.
Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Light: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.
Proficiency: martial, shortsword
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Tooth of the Red Dragon
item.text: Rarity: Legendary
Requires attunement

This legendary weapon is one of 10 blades that make up the Mouth of the Dragon. This greatsword was forged in the firey breath of Veilendrex, an ancient red dragon. It was he who started building the Mouth of the Dragon by enslaving wizards, sorcerers and clerics. When drawn, the runes that race down the blade glow with red fury, spelling out Veilendrex * the mouth of the dragon. His gold tipped tail wraps around the blade close to the cross guard. His body makes up the hilt, each scale is encrusted with crushed red rubies. His masive head is the pommel, sculpted in anger. Smoke wafts out of the mouth as the blade is swung in combat.

You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. You can use a bonus action to speak this sword's command word * Veilendrex, causing flames to erupt from the blade. These flames shead bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the sword is ablase, it deals an extra 3d6 fire damage to any target it hits. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword. In addition, while you hold the sword, you have vulnerability to cold damage.
Once per day the wielder of the blade can cast fireball as a 5th level spell, however the normal flame function will not work until the dawn of the following day.
Heavy: Small creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small creature to use effectively.
Two-Handed: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.
Proficiency: martial, greatsword
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Tooth of the Bronze Dragon
item.text: Rarity: Legendary
Requires attunement

You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. On a successful melee hit the blade, the target takes an extra 3d6 cold damage. In addition, while you hold the sword, you have vulnerability to fire damage.
Versatile: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property — the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Flan's Longbow of Lightning
item.text: Rarity: Legendary

Flan, a hero of a bygone god, had this bow crafted out of the heart of a yew tree for his quest to save the harbor master's daughter from the villainous goblin horde. It was his lightning reflexes and essence that embed the yew shaft and provides the extra punch that this bow offers.

As part of an attack action, on the first successfully hit target, every creature in a 15 foot diameter radius from the target needs to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d4 electrical damage, and no damage on a successful save.

Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.
If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.
Heavy: Small creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small creature to use effectively.

Range: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range
Two-Handed: This weapon requires two hands to use.
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Cornel's Spear Of The Magi
item.detail: legendary (requires attunement by a Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard)
item.text:
legendary (requires attunement by a Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard)
This spear can be wielded as a magic spear that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While you hold it, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls. The spear has 50 charges for the following properties. It regains 4d6+2 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 20, the staff regains 1d12+1 charges.
Spell Absorption: While holding the spear, you have advantage on saving throws against spells. In addition, you can use your reaction when another creature casts a spell that targets only you. If you do, the staff absorbs the magic of the spell, canceling its effect and gaining a number of charges equal to the absorbed spell's level. However, if doing so brings the spear's total number of charges above 50, the spear explodes as if you activated its retributive strike (see below).
Spells: While holding the spear, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability: conjure elemental (7 charges), dispel magic (3 charges), fireball (7th-level version, 7 charges), flaming sphere (2 charges), ice storm (4 charges), invisibility (2 charges), knock (2 charges), lightning bolt (7th-level version, 7 charges), passwall (5 charges), plane shift (7 charges), telekinesis (5 charges), wall of fire (4 charges), or web (2 charges) You can also use an action to cast one of the following spells from the spear without using any charges: arcane lock, detect magic, enlarge/reduce, light, mage hand, or protection from evil and good.
Retributive Strike: You can use an action to break the spear over your knee or against a solid surface, performing a retributive strike. The spear is destroyed and releases its remaining magic in an explosion that expands to fill a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on it. You have a 50 percent chance to instantly travel to a random plane of existence, avoiding the explosion. If you fail to avoid the effect, you take force damage equal to 16 x the number of charges in the staff. Every other creature in the area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes an amount of damage based on how far away it is from the point of origin, as shown in the following table. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.
Distance from Origin — Damage: 10 ft. away or closer — 8 x the number of charges in the spear 11 to 20 ft. away — 6 x the number of charges in the spear 21 to 30 ft. away — 4 x the number of charges in the spear
Proficiency: simple, spear Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Qwalth's Blade
item.text: Rarity: Legendary

This legendary shortsword is also known as a the Giant's hamstring, after the favored tactic of the renown fighter Qwalth. In the age of Giants, Qwalth left the dwarven holds, along side his brethren, and joined battle to drive them back. This finely crafted mithril blade, golden crossguard and sapphire pommeled sword was almost as feared among the giants as Qwalth himself. The legend of the pair during the wars was well warranted and often a turning point when they took the field.
This shortsword grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

When you hit a giant with it, the giant takes an extra 2d6 damage of the weapon's type and must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or fall prone. For the purpose of this weapon, "giant" refers to any creature with the giant type, including ettins and trolls.
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Hecton the Bald' Striking Spear
item.text: Rarity: Legendary
Requires Attunement

Range: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.

Thrown: If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon.
Versatile: This weapon can be used with one or two hands.
This legendary weapon was created by the wizard Hecton the Bald. In times long ago, his accuracy with his spells were legendary and only became more so after he crafted the spear.

The ash wood for the shaft has been petrified by the gaze of a Madusa. The spear head is forged of damascus steel. An ancient blue dragon's roar merged the two components of the spear into one unified object.
This spear grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While you hold it, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls.
When thrown as part of an attack action, the spear will do an extra 3D6 of thunder damage on a successful hit. This property can be used once per short rest.
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Perthshire's Infernal Armor
item.text: Rarity: Legendary

Perthshire was a hero that often delved down into the depths of hell to battle Devils and Demons. During his many raids he learned that if you properly harvested Devil skins and added specially prepared studs, it will make quite the suit of Studded Leather armor.

The bulk of the suit of armor is constructed from a pit fiend named Wrethzzoglich. His hide, tanned a dark red. The metal studs have taken on a black hue, to reflect the black nature of Wrethzzoglick's heart.
You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.
Magical Resistance: the wearer of this armor has resistance to magic spells and magical effects
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Robe of the Morning Lord
item.text: Rarity: Legendary
Requires Attunement by a Cleric
This elegant garment is made from exquisite cloth of white, gray, and black. It is also adorned with silvery runes.

This magical garment is also known as the High Vestment of Lethander, legend has it that he was wearing it when he ascended to the outer planes. After his ascension, his disciples donned the robes to continue his work on this plane.
You gain these benefits while wearing the robe:
* If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 15 + your Dexterity modifier.
* If you aren't wearing armor, the Robe also conveys the following spell like effects.
The robe holds 15 charges for the following properties. It regains 1d6 + 2 expended charges daily at dawn.

Spells: While wearing the robe, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability: Spiritual weapon (1 charges), daylight (at will), freedom of movement (3 charges), guardian of faith (3 charges), mass cure wounds (3d8 + 10 healing, 5 charges), firestorm (15 charges)
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Lendarth's Death Dance Bracers
item.text: Rarity: Legendary
Requires Attunement by a Fighter (Battle Master) or someone with the feat: Martial Adept

Lendarth was a legendary hero of a bygone era. His death dance was a thing of beauty, often causing even his opponents to stare in wonder as death descended. He made a heroic sacrifice in the Lich Wars opening battle. He fell holding a bridge as the defeated army retreated. This was his greatest dance, laying waste to the Lich lords skeleton troops. Something in that fight was absorbed by the bracers he wore, for when they were given to his next of kin, his dance could be seen in her fighting style.
The bracers holds 5 charges. It regains 1d4-1 expended charges daily at dawn.

While wearing the bracers, as part of an attack action that uses a Battle Master Maneuver you can use one or more charges to increase the superiority die type by one category per charge expended. A d6 becomes a d8, d8 becomes a d10, d10 becomes a d12 and a d12 becomes a d20.
If the bracers remain at 0 charges for two consecutive days, it's enchantment is broken and it is now considered a mundane set of brackers.
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Mage Armor Spell
item.text: this is the mage armor spell translated into an item for use.
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Backbreaker
item.text: Rarity: Rare

Backbreaker was originally forged during THE SECOND AGE and used by the forces of the mind flayers. It eventually fell into the hands of the Slaad hero Crroock. Crroock used the weapon to great effect during it's lifetime, but eventually Crroock and the blade went missing. Backbreaker resurfaced again during THE FOURTH AGE as the primary weapon of the Orc War Chief Plunyyak and became the tribal weapon of the Backbreaker Clan.

Backbreaker remained with the Backbreaker clan until it's might was smashed by the encroaching elves of Helms. There Backbreaker was both a trophy and family heirloom weapon of the Umbra-Vastator family. During The War of Elven Submission the blade was captured by the Order of the White Rose and placed in Boarderland's The Manor of Infinite Mirrors.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. On a successful melee hit against aberrations the target will also take an extra 1d6 radiant damage.

The sword holds three charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge as an action to cast banishment using DC 14 for the charisma saving throw and using your concentration to maintain the effect. It regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.
Versatile: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property — the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.
Proficiency: martial, longsword
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: The Sword of Hevedious
item.text: This +1 longsword was lost during the sacking of Hevedious in year 319 (Lendarth Reckoning). It is believed that the blade disappeared with most of the priceless artwork that lined the walls of the Hall of Gauis Hevedious.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.
Versatile: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property — the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.
Proficiency: martial, longsword
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Arrow of Manndar's Blessing
item.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack made with this piece of magic ammunition. On a successful ranged hit, roll damage normally but instead of reducing the targets hitpoints, the attack restores amount rolled.
Once this piece of ammunition has been used, it cannot be used again until the following dawn.
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Bolt of Manndar's Blessing
item.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack made with this piece of magic ammunition. On a successful ranged hit, roll damage normally but instead of reducing the targets hitpoints, the attack restores amount rolled.
Once this piece of ammunition has been used, it cannot be used again until the following dawn.
Source: Custom item in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

item.name: Stone of Manndar's Blessing
